abstracts.cdata!:
The environmental assessment covers: the
            atmospheric environmental impact on the area 500 meters from
            each side of the central line of the proposed expressway;
            and the noise and vibration studies on the belt area up to
            500 meters from each shoulder of the expressway.  More
            specifically, the study assesses the impact on the
            environment based on the following: 1) atmospheric
            background quality standard; 2) ambient noise standard for
            urban areas; 3) maximum permissable concentration of
            atmospheric pollutants for the protection of agricultural
            crops; 4) farmland irrigation water quality standards; 5)
            environmental quality standards of surface water; 6) sea
            water quality standards; 7) environmental vibration
            standards in city regions; 8) lead and inorganic compounds
            hygienic standards of atmosphere; and 9) noise criteria for
            construction sites.
